text.text: How can I access the All Claim Details report?

text: To access the All Claim Details report, you can go to the navigation bar, hover over Analytics, and click Reports. Then, scroll down the list and click All Claim Details. You can also export the report to a .csv file.

text.text: What are the available options for the date filter type in the report?

text: The date filter type options for the All Claim Details report are: Date of Service or Billed Date.

text.text: Can you explain the significance of analyzing trends and specifications in the All Claim Details report?

text: The All Claim Details report shows all open claims with a remaining balance and/or all closed claims. It includes fields of information such as: Add'l diagnosis codes, Tertiary payer name, Date of birth, Patient name, Run number, Tertiary payer authorization, Pick up location, Date of service number.

text.text: What actions can be taken based on the findings of the All Claim Details report?

text: The All Claim Details report can be used to compare the posted amount to your bank statement. It can also be used as an indicator of payment posting productivity.

text.text: How can the report help in analyzing base rate and mileage charges?

text: The Claim Charge Details report can be used to view all base rate and mileage charges by HCPCS for a claim. The report can be found on the Claim page under the Charges tab. It is recommended to export the report to .csv and use Excel to analyze the data.

text.text: How can I download or print the Claim Charge Details report?

text: To run the report, you can use the download and/or print capabilities at the top right.

text.text: How does the report assist in identifying discrepancies in charges?

text: The All Charge Details report can be used to identify discrepancies in charges. The report contains the following columns of information: HCPCS code, quantity, and charge amount Account and claim number Accounting period Patient name Billed date and billed by Payer Policy Claim charge amount Date of service Profit center One of the best way to digest the information in the report is to export the report to a .csv file.

text.text: How do I access the Billed Claims report?

text: The Billed Claims report is a biller productivity report. It shows the number of claims submitted by each biller on a daily basis. It can be used to identify baselines and see when productivity increases or decreases. If payments are not coming in, you can run the Billed Claims report for a few weeks back to see if you were running less trips during that time period.

text.text: How does the report serve as a biller productivity report?

text: The Billed Claims report shows the number of claims submitted by each biller on a daily basis. It can be used to identify baselines and see when productivity increases or decreases. If payments are not coming in, you can run the Billed Claims report for a few weeks back to see if you were running less trips during that time period.

text.text: Can you explain the significance of the two levels of detail in the exported Excel file?

text: The two levels of detail in the exported Excel file are: Biller Totals by Day and Claim Details by Day. The Biller Totals by Day tab shows how many claims the biller submitted and the billed amount. The Claim Details by Day tab shows the number of claims submitted by each biller on a daily basis.

text.text: What actions should be taken based on the findings of the Billed Claims report?

text: The Billed Claims report is a biller productivity report. It shows the number of claims submitted by each biller on a daily basis. It can be used to identify baselines and see when productivity increases or decreases. If payments are not coming in, you can run the Billed Claims report for a few weeks back to see if you were running less trips during that time period.

text.text: What does the Trip Reconciliation report display?

text: The Trip Reconciliation report displays cases that were manually created and imported within a specific time period. It is recommended to use the report every week to reconcile claims in Billing against trips in your patient care system to ensure that all trips have, or will, be billed.

text.text: How often should I use the Trip Reconciliation report?

text: It is recommended to use the Trip Reconciliation report every week to reconcile claims in Billing against trips in your patient care system to ensure that all trips have, or will, be billed.

text.text: How can I compare reports from ZOLL Billing and the patient care system?

text: To compare reports from ZOLL Billing and the patient care system, you can run the Trip Reconciliation report in ZOLL Billing and then run a equivalent report in your patient care system using the same time period. You can then compare the two to verify that all exported PCRs are being addressed within ZOLL Billing.

text.text: Can you explain the significance of the date range selection in running the report?

text: The date range you enter to run the report is based on the claim's date of service. For example, 9/8/2020 to 10/8/2020 would display all claims with the date of service in that date range.

text.text: What information is provided in the Claim Creation Type column?

text: The Claim Creation Type column displays how the claim was created.

text.text: How does the report help in ensuring all trips are billed accurately?

text: The Trip Reconciliation report shows cases that were manually created and imported within a specific time period. It is recommended to use the report every week to reconcile claims in Billing against trips in your patient care system to ensure that all trips have, or will, be billed.

text.text: Can you provide examples of scenarios where the Trip Reconciliation report is useful?

text: The Trip Reconciliation report can be used to reconcile trips imported into ZOLL Billing. For example, you can use the report to identify which facilities you pick-up from and drop-off to the most. You can also use the report to verify that all exported PCRs are being addressed within ZOLL Billing.

text.text: What actions should be taken after reconciling the reports?

text: After reconciling the reports, you can compare the two to verify that all exported PCRs are being addressed within ZOLL Billing.

text.text: How does the report contribute to improving billing efficiency?

text: The report can also be used to track and resolve problem trips, which can improve billing efficiency.

text.text: How to run All Claim Details report?

text: To run the All Claim Details report, you can follow these steps: 1. On the navigation bar, hover over Analytics and click Reports 2. Scroll down the list and click All Claim Details 3. Accounting Period Start Date: Click this field and select the accounting period date 4. Profit Centers: Click this field to select one or more profit centers to include in the report 5. Display Inactive Zones: If you want to include inactive profit center zones, select True 6. Display HCPCS: If you want to include HCPCS, select True 7. Click View Report.

text.text: what is the use of All Claim Details report?

text: The All Claim Details report shows all open claims with a remaining balance and/or all closed claims. It also includes supporting information such as claim status, claim type, and claim amount.

text.text: What is the use of Billed Claims report?

text: The Billed Claims report is a biller productivity report. It shows the number of claims submitted by each biller on a daily basis, identifies their baselines, and sees when productivity increases or decreases. If payments are not coming in, you can run Billed Claims for a few weeks back to see if you were running less trips during that time period.

text.text: What is the use of Trip Reconciliation report?

text: The Trip Reconciliation report shows cases that were manually created and imported within a specific time period. Recommended use: Use the Trip Reconciliation report every week to reconcile claims in Billing against trips in your patient care system to ensure that all trips have, or will, be billed.

text.text: How do I Print running balance report?

text: The Print running balances report is available on the Account page under the Claims tab. The report shows the running balance of all the claims associated with the account. There is an option to print the running balance.
